characters: A GROUP OF ARMED WORSE GUYS
ALRIGHT EVERYBODY DOWN OR I BLOW
FADE IN ON THE INSIDE OF A HELICOPTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June exits balancing the tray of coffees in one hand and several bags of muffins in the other. IT STARTS RAINING a she loads them into her TOYOTA COROLLA. INT. JUNE’S CAR - SAME As she drives, listening to an ITALIAN LANGUAGE INSTRUCTI TAPE, repeating after it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Io vado prendere il pesce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POURING RAIN. June is the only one mounting the front ste for the entrance. It’s still that early. pnp.  INT. JUNE’S FLOOR - MORNING June steps off the elevator, zigzags her way through a hu bullpen of still-empty cubicles. Placing a coffee in one, muffin in another... She gets to a corner of the floor, a GLASSED-IN OFFICE th She goes into the office, sets coffee and a muffin down o the desk. Carefully straightens the papers there. June sets the last coffee down at her desk (right outside glassed-in office), sits down and “straps in”: puts on he telephone headset, her Carpal Tunnel wrist guards, takes water bottle from her purse, sets it on the clean desk, a starts typing on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: As people begin filing in for work. Those that find coffe waiting for them peek over the top of their cubicles.

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Thanks, June.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (working) You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: (holds up a muffin) Hey, June--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (working) It’s fat-free sugar-free.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You‘re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: YET ANOTHER CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: You rock, June. June works away at her computer, images of exotic cities her screen -- Paris, Rome, Dubai... images of the hotels. beaches, etc.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: June!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: see  4. June stands up as MR. HEARN, fifties, paunchy, heads into glassed-in office. On his way in...

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: On your desk. —

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: Video conference?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: All set to go.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: Toner cartridge?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: It's... wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: The inkjet color toner cartridge. The one my printer needs. The one I told you about.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: On the way here. I e-mailed you. I said I needed it taken care of before I got to the office. Before.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I haven’t had a chance to check my e-mail in the last few minutes. Mr. Hearn sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: June, do you know how replaceable I am?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: There are at least five hundred thousand people out there who could do my job better than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t say that--

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: It’s true. They’re younger, smarter, better looking. So I need everyone on my staff to be on the ball, to do their jobs well, ‘cause it makes me look better than I actually am. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: Good. Because, June, we're all replaceable.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I‘'1ll get the toner cartridge.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: You do that. He heads into his office. June looks around at the others the office, who stare. They quickly turn back to their wo embarrassed. INT. JUNE'S MOM’S APARTMENT - DAY The place is a warm and comfortable mess -- colorful, mismatched furniture, funky tchotchkes -- the opposite of June’s condo. In the midst of the clutter, JUNE’S MOM happily packs up suitcase. June bursts through the door carrying two arm- fulls of groceries.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (quickly) I’m going to be late getting back to work. I had to go to three stores to get your fiber. Remember, you've got to take it twice a day. She starts hurriedly putting the groceries away in the cabinets and fridge, then notices her mom packing.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (wary) You going somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNE’S’ MOM Nevada.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What for? JUNE’S MOM Burning Man.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Burning Man? The festival? JUNE’S MOM Mm-hmm. I read about it in the paper this morning, and it looks amazing. June steps between her mother and the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Mom, you can‘t keep doing this to me. JUNE’'S MOM I’m not doing anything to you, June. I’m just living my life. Try it. It’s fun. She steps around her daughter and continues packing.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Look, just because. I don’t choose to live my life like a carny doesn’t make it any less satisfying. JUNE’S MOM Some people are perfectly happy being an assistant at Fidelity their whole lives, and that’s great. You‘’re just not one of them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: How would you know? JUNE’S MOM Because you’re my daughter. There’s got to be some of me in there somewhere -~ some little adventurous gene, dying to get out. Just try something different while I’m gone -- anything. Go skydiving. Get drunk at the zoo. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNE'S MOM (cont'd) Oooh, I know! Date an exciting stranger. Try that website, Mate- dot-com. JUNE . I am not doing the internet dating thing. JUNE’S MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Junie. It’s not just for losers anymore.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Is that their slogan? It’s catchy. Look, I'm perfectly capable of meeting men on my own. JUNE’S MOM Sure, you meet them, you date them, but it never lasts, does it? And why's that?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Because I introduce them to you? JUNE’S MOM Because they’re everything you say you want -- dependable, straight- laced, solid career -- but you dump them anyway. Because, deep down, you know you could never have the kind of life you really want. Not with them, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You know what? I’ve got to get back to work. Enjoy Burning Man. Don’t: get arrested.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE'S MOM
dialogues.text: No promises. June kisses her mom's cheek and hurries out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June rides up, lost in thought. INT. OFFICE - JUNE’S FLOOR - DAY dune steps off the elevator, sees a crowd of her CO-WORKE gathered around a beaming 50-SOMETHING WOMAN. Mr. Hearn leads the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we celebrate Elaine Glazer and her thirty years of service to this company. Elaine, on behalf of the Fidelity family, this is for you. He hands the woman a box. She eagerly opens it and pulls a generic DESK CLOCK. She’s looks genuinely happy to get

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: Read the inscription.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (giddily) “Elaine: Congratulations on 30 years.” This is great. Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: MR. HEARN
dialogues.text: No, thank you! Here’s to another thirty years. Or at least fifteen. The crowd applauds and breaks up quickly, leaving June standing there uneasily. The beaming woman sets the clock down in her cubicle, the goes back to work. Business as usual. June stares, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparse. Spotless. June sits at the kitchen table, finishe dinner. She gets up, rinses her one plate, one glass, one fork an one knife and puts them into the drying rack. She stands there a moment, staring at the lonely place setting, then leaves the kitchen... ROMANTIC MUSIC OVER...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: An explosion of lights around it. A COUPLE KISSING PASSIONATELY in f.g. WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL: The image is on A COMPUTER SCREEN. REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June sits in bed with her laptop.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of couples in various romantic locales. Restaurant Walking on beaches. Holding hands. Laughing. Toasting...

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: At Mate-dot-com, your life begins now. Go ahead. Take the plunge... And now we see a HANDSOME MAN dive into a remote tropical pool, swims up to an ALLURING WOMAN and kisses her. A couple ride together on a motor scooter through the cob streets of a romantic European city. Another gorgeous couple slow dance outside, at night, and PULL BACK TO REVEAL they’re doing it in front of Trevi Fountain. And finally, this incredibly tan, blond, pumped-up GUY in surf trunks walks out of the ocean carrying a lobster.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: My name is Rick. I’m a Pediatric Cardiologist. I’m waiting for you on Mate-dot-com. (smiles) What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: ON JUNE
dialogues.text: Staring at the screen. She takes a breath, starts typing we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s pouring rain. Inside, June sits at a table, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June, dressed up, hair up, sits at a table. She’s anxious She checks her watch. She’s been sitting here a while. She looks at the menu, looks up as A MAN comes in the doo looks around. She sits up, hopeful as he walks towards he but then continues walking and joins a big GROUP in the b The MAITRE D’ approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAITRE D’ Mademoiselle, are you sure I can’t get you something while you wait? A glass of wine, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No, thank you. The reservation was for eight o’clock, wasn’t it? MAITRE D’ Yes, ma’am. She glances at a clock that says NINE O'CLOCK. MAITRE D’ But you know-- the weather...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, there was a terrible accident downtown. If I hadn’t left an hour early-- he’s probably caught in that. MAITRE D’ Yes. I’m sure of it. June sits there a moment. Feels the looks from the other diners. Before she can stop herself, she starts to cry. T Maitre D’ and a waiter look away. MAITRE D’ Bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s RAINING as A FIGURE in an overcoat, collar pulled up hurriedly crosses the street, glancing over his shoulder. The Figure moves past the restaurant, but backs up, seein June along at her table, crying. He stands there, his bac to us, watching her. We HEAR A HELICOPTER. The Figure turns, sees A SEARCHLIGH SWEEP THE STREET. He ducks inside the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June dabs at her eyes, picks up her purse, is about to st when...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1l. She looks up sees the MAN IN THE OVERCOAT standing there. see him clearly for the first time. He’s suave, good- looking, Italian shoes, three thousand dollar suit.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Are you...?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: June, yeah. Andrew?

dialogues.speaker: MAN/ANDREW
dialogues.text: Guilty. I’m so sorry. How long have you been--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: --Oh, not long. That’s okay. He shakes her hand, smiles at her. She can’t believe her luck. She looks around at the other diners, many looking this way. He takes off his coat and sits.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Just so you know, this is not me. I‘m not that guy who keeps a lady waiting.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What guy are you?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Right now, a thirsty guy. He opens the wine list, studies it...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You look like a red girl to me. A big bold red... Andrew begins speaking in flawless French. She watches, dazzled as the Maitre D’ laughs at something Andrew says, then bows and moves on to fetch the wine. Andrew turns ba to her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Have you done this before?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What? Had dinner with a beautiful woman? Once or twice.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (blush) No... computer dated.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Oh... No. Can't say that I have.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Why did you pick me? S

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Look at you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: But I didn’t post a picture.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No. I know, but... there was so much beauty in how you described yourself. In your words.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Plus, June was my mother’s name. This gets her smiling again. The Waiter brings the wine. Andrew nods at the wine.label when the waiter shows it to him. The Waiter then starts to open the bottle...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You had some good words yourself. It was your poem that got me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: My poem.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: It was... amazing.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Please don’t make me recite it now.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That first line is so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Roses are red--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Okay, I won’t force you.  , 13. He just smiles as the waiter pours the wine. She watches taste it like a pro, nod his approval. The waiter pours t each a glass and Andrew raises his.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What should we toast to?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Taking risks.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Good one. They touch glasses and drink, her eyes on him the whole t The girl believes she has won the lottery. Andrew glances over her shoulder as TWO LARGE MEN IN SUITS AND OVERCOATS move past the window now. He puts his hand in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Man, it's really raining out there. June turns to look out the window and Andrew DROPS A SMAL OBJECT INTO HER PURSE. It looks like, well, a small ACTIO FIGURE. She then turns back...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Where did you learn to speak Prench?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Junior High. She looks at him. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I learned on the job.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: As a bankruptcy lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Boy, you really do read those profiles. (then) My... old job. International relations. I speak a dozen languages, and a few dialects.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Fluently?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Just enough to order a decent bottle of wine.  14. He toasts again, and again they drink. She loves it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Very decent. So you travel a lot?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Constantly. You?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) Not so much. But someday I’m going to quit my job and just see the world for a couple of years.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Some day? Why wait? Boom. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with right now?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. What is wrong with right now?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Most people live their entire lives waiting for that big thing or that big moment to come along and change everything. And you know what happens?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Nothing. They spend their lives waiting. But that’s not me.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (entranced) Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You wanna know something, June? (leans closer) We're gonna be dead for a lot longer than we’re gonna be alive. Think about that.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (gone) We are, aren't we?  15.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: So why wait? And with that she leans across the table and kisses him. long kiss, he looks at her, looks past her to the door wh TWO LARGE MEN IN SUITS enter the restaurant, look around. pulls away first. She looks at him,

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I don’t know what--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No. That was great, that was unbelievably good. I really enjoyed it, but... (pushes back) Could you excuse me for just a minute?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Sure. He gets up, heads for the back of the restaurant as the t big men now move through the dining room. June sits there humiliated. Tries not to look left or right. We HOLD ON her. She'd climb into her shoe if she could. Then...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: June?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Listen, I don’t know what got into me-- She stops. A GUY, soaked to the bone in a suit stands the

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. I got a flat tire and wouldn’t you know it, my cell phone died and I couldn't call--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Who. are you?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Andrew. Munson. June now looks around the restaurant. He sits down. Sees the full wine glass in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUY ‘ Oh. You ordered wine. I should have told you... I’m allergic to grapes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As “Andrew” quickly moves through the rain, turns up an alley. We hear...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Milner! And TWO HUGE MEN step in front of him, pointing guns at h

dialogues.speaker: HUGE MAN
dialogues.text: * Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Thank you! I would love to go for a ride with you guys. The Huge Man speaks into his collar mike.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE MAN
dialogues.text: We got him. INT. JUNE’S CAR - DRIVING - NIGHT June drives home, crying, humiliated, furious with hersel She listens to her Italian tape to try and calm down...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Io vado prendere il pesce... I'll have the f-- BOOM! Suddenly A BODY CRASHES ONTO HER WINDSHIELD... and rolls off the front of the car! June SCREAMS and slam the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June jumps out, rushing to the body.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Are you okay?! The body COUGHS and rolls over. It’s MILNER. June stares shock as he struggles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You?!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Oh, man, that really hurt...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Are you following me? He can’t speak, he’s hurting pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Where’d you come from?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner looks up. June follows his gaze to an OVERPASS.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You jumped onto my car?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Didn’t look so high from up there... He sits up. Looks at her. Extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: John.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That's my name. John Milner.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: John Milner. Right. Like I’m going to believe anything you say after you lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I only lied about the little things. The important stuff was true.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Look, just leave me alone, alright? 4 She starts to head back for her car, but sees him struggl get up, his knees buckle and June has to grab him. ,

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No-- No hospitals... (then) But maybe another kiss?  18. She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Because that first one was--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: A mistake.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Was perfect. Who taught you to kiss like that?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (lets him drop) . You're insane. Whatever your problem is, it’s not my problem--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well, actually--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I’m out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June-— She leaves him there, gets back in her car. INT. JUNE’S CAR - SAME June looks at Milner sitting there in the headlights, the quickly pulls back onto the road. She drives past him, he calls her name, but she keeps going. She looks in the rearview, sees him struggling to stand u He falls and passes out. She pounds on the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June pulls up to the ER and opens the back door, revealin Milner lying on the back seat. JUNE é Hello! I need some help here! TWO DOCTORS appear, -hoisting Milner onto a gurney.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: What happened?  19.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just found him on the side of the road. (as they wheel him away) He’s all yours... .June heads back to her car, getting the hell out of ther

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Miss! June stops, guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the doctors wheel Milner toward the elevator, June sta at the ADMITTING DESK facing a NURSE with a name tag that reads “CHERYL.”

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: I need you to fill out an admit form.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Look, I really don’t want to get involved. I don’t even know the guy. He just fell on my car--

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: BP’s dropping through the floor... June can’t help but shoot a worried peek at Milner as he disappears into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner lies on the gurney in a white shirt and suit coat.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Let’s get this off him. The doctor tries to rip Milner’s shirt but it doesn’t bud It‘s made of some high-tech, rubberized material.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 2
dialogues.text: That's weird--. He takes out a scalpel. Milner’s eyes pop open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Cheryl slides a clipboard across her desk:

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: Ma‘am, if your friend was injured during a crime--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: He’s not my friend. I just made a mistake, thinking it would so easy to meet a guy--

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: Ma‘ am--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Like, you know, you could just hit send and all of a sudden you're not alone anymore.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: Ma’ am-— JUNE . He's not my problem. He’s trouble. They're all trouble...

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: Honey, if you left the scene of any sort of felony or accident without telling anybody who you are, then you're gonna be in a lot of trouble. Understand? (passes her the form) So, just to be safe... June stares at the forms, makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Fine. Whatever. I just wanna get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June walks to her car, rummages through her purse for her keys, comes up with them, her hand shaking, accidentally drops them. It’s too much...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Dammit! She finally gets in the car, and she pulls out of the ER entrance. Suddenly, A BLACK SEDAN with GOVERNMENT PLATES roars past, almost hitting her. ccc g:  2l. INT. JUNE’S CAR - NIGHT June watches them hurry inside, quickly pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four SUITS approach Nurse Cheryl. We recognize two of the AGENTS from the restaurant. Front and center is ACKERMAN, small man with no smile, no small talk and no patience.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Special Agent Ackerman, FBI. Beside him is a BIG RED HEADED AGENT. When he speaks we s that he has BRACES on his teeth. He holds up a security camera photo of Milner:.

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: Have you seen this man? Nurse Cheryl checks the photo.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: You got ID, gentlemen? Annoyed, Braces and Ackerman flash their badges.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: He was unconscious. They just took him upstairs. I’11 find out where. (dials phone, then) Nancy? Hi. This is Cheryl down in admitting. No, not Gomez. Cheryl Kublick. Cheryl G is Filipino and weighs like three hundred pounds-- Ackerman pounds his palm‘on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: (to Ackerman) You want to keep that hand? Take it off my desk. Ackerman eyes her, but takes his hand off.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Listen, where did you put the guy we sent up a few minutes ago? (then) The guy -- name’s John Milner. What? Well, check again. He should be-- .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! They all turn to see the elevator doors open... REVEALING both Doctors slumped on the floor. The suits draw their weapons. The escape door on the ceil is open and Milner’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: (to his men) Find him. Now! Ackerman’s men spring into action. Ackerman turns to Nurs Cheryl.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Where are the stairs?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: Right down that hall... (grabs the admitting form) But you should know there was a-- Ackerman’s WALKIE squeaks to life.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT, (ON WALKIE)
dialogues.text: We got something on four. And he’s out of there. She puts the clipboard down on the counter. Fine. Whatever. INT. JUNE’S CAR - NIGHT June pulls onto the highway. She drives along, takes deep breaths, gets herself together. After a while, she laughs

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The internet. Jesus. What was I thinking? Behind June, we see Milner sit up in the back seat. He ho a GUN...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Exactly, June, what were you thinking? June SCREAMS, swerving across the road. Milner waves the as he talks... .

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You're lucky. I mean, you could've met someone really crazy...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I need you to pull over... She jams on the brakes, pulling over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June jumps out of the car like it’s on fire.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?! Milner stumbles out behind her, waving the gun...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Me? What about you? I mean, what’s someone looks as good as you do, trolling the internet...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That’s really none of your . business.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (waving the gun) C’mon, June, I know people. I get a-- (taps his gut with th: gun) : --feeling and I’m never wrong. And I got that feeling with you, like something happened. I mean, how's it possible you don’t have a man? She doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: . MILNER
dialogues.text: But, hey, we‘ll get to that, right now I need your help...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Help? Really? Because it kinda looks like-- (indicates the gun) --you wanna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June, I’m not trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: How do I know that?  24.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Because you’re not dead. Listen, I borrowed some stuff from the hospital-- He reaches into an inside pocket and takes out some banda alcohol, needle and thread. June takes out her cell...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I'm calling the cops.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Good luck with that. When June presses TALK on her cell, all she hears is STAT

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So how’s it work, you look for women eating by themselves... then what, get them to invest all their Money in some pyramid scheme, or do. you just kill them, make a bathrobe out of their skin?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: A bathrobe out of their-- June. You looked sad. I wasn’t gonna go inside, wasn’t planning on it, but I saw you sitting there, all alone, and... well, I couldn’t help myself. She says nothing to that. Doesn’t know if he’s telling th truth or not.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I was really enjoying our dinner. And I am sorry that I. left, but I had bigger issues, like, y’know, the fate of the world, to think about.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The fate of the world. Right. Okay... She starts backing away.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Oh, man... Milner slumps against a tree, doubling over.  25.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You should be in a hospital. And not the regular kind of hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I just need a mirror. (looks at her) Please. June rifles her purse, hands it to him...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Here. She starts to walk away, but--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hold this light for me. Milner holds out a pen and June reluctantly takes it. She about to click the top when--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Wait! Don’t touch that. (casually) Just turn the cap. June does and the pen turns into a strangely high-powered flashlight. It illuminates a bloody wound on Milner’s sid

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: My God, you've been shot.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It happens. June goes gray as Milner sets some supplies next to her p and starts prepping.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: It goes all the way through.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Finally, some good news.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I think I’m gonna be sick--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Don't look. As June turns away, she moves: the flashlight completely the wound.  26.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m gonna need you to look. June holds up the mirror and the light so Milner can see. douses the wound with alcohol but it’s June who winces. Milner doesn’t feel a thing. He pierces the skin, sewing himself up.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t think I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Sure you can, just listen to my voice. June takes a deep breath. He goes to work.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: So why were you alone?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay. He works some more.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The poem guy didn’t show, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: He was late. He got a flat tire.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Really? How'd he do?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You owe him six hundred dollars for the wine.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: He get a kiss?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Please stop bringing that up. She looks at Milner as he finishes sewing himself up. He ties off the excess thread with the effortless agility of trained surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Who are you?  27.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I told you, John Milner.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Okay, what are you?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That I can’t tell you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Why? Because then you'd have to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No. Because other people would kill you. And then I'd feel bad. (then) You might want to look away for this next part. She turns away. And Milner uses the opportunity to remove the object, the action figure, from her purse. He slips i into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I’ve put you through enough as is. Okay, you can look now. She turns as Milner stands and buttons his stained, blood shirt. He takes out the gun, expertly jacks the clip, and puts it back again. He re-holsters it, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, June. You'll never see me again. There’s something sad about the way he says that.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help. And I really am sorry for walking out like that. It was very nice meeting you. Milner turns and walks away. A beat, then June calls afte him-- .

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Hey! She approaches and hands Milner some clean bandages.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You should take these. And keep the wound damp.  28.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I thought you had to keep it dry.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I just read that now they think it's better to keep it damp.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: They keep changing their minds. One minute they say fried food and cigarettes are bad for you, the next...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Fried food and cigarettes are bad for you.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Huh. Well... (takes the bandages) Thanks. ° Milner walks off. After a few paces, he stops, looks at t bandages in his hand -- damn it. He turns and comes back.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: : Listen, you need to know something. a There’s uh, some people gonna come looking for me, which unfortunately means they’re gonna come looking for you, too.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: But I don’t know anything--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No, but you were seen with me in the hospital... which, by the way, is why I told you not to take me there. But-- (holds up a hand) Water under the bridge. Important thing for you to know now is that these boys are professionals. If they want to find you, they will. They’1l identify themselves as FBI and tell you some bullshit story about me. It’1ll all sound very convincing, but it’s extremely important that you do not go with them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Okay, Milner, or whatever you wanna call yourself, why should I believe anything you say? Milner pulls out a badge, barely shows it to her before h puts it back.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Because I'm in the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You just told me what you did.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: They’re gonna kill you anyway. She stands there, doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Now, if you do happen to go with them, and they don’t take you straight to a police station or the local bureau office... If they take you anywhere else -- even if they tell you you’re safe -- it means they're going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: If they tell me I’m safe--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: They're gonna kill you. Now here's the important part: there’1ll probably be a oner in the back.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: A what-er?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: A piece, a glock, a gat. Probably ad.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (shocked) A gun?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Half the time they forget it’s there. If it’s a Caprice, it’ll be under the seat, between your legs. If it’s a Crown Vic, it’s ina panel in the seat in front of you. Got it?  30.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Don’t got it. Don’t want it. I hate guns.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You’1l hate them less when you really need one. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Trust you. Milner starts backing away.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hey, June? That kiss was really something. Milner then turns and heads off into the night and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman and one of his AGENTS examine the elevator housi The door has been kicked off the hinge.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: We lost him. Ackerman. sees the trail of blood to the edge, looks down the roof of the garage...

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: He'd never go to a hospital. I trained him better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman steps off the elevator, crosses to the admitting desk. Nurse Cheryl looks up as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE CHERYL
dialogues.text: So you’re ready to listen now?

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Who brought him in? INT. JUNE’S CONDO - DAWN As the sun rises, we hear June’s ALARM buzz, O.S. INT. JUNE’S BEDROOM - DAWN June awakens groggily, reaches over to the nightstand to off her alarm. Her hand fumbles to find it. It’s not ther

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, she sits up to see ACKERMAN holding the alarm c out of her reach. A ROOM FULL OF AGENTS IN SWAT GEAR stand around her bed, pointing guns at her. Ackerman turns off the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Good morning, Ms. Holyfield. (then) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Milner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June sits on the couch in shock as Ackerman drops a photograph on the coffee table. June looks uncomfortably the big red headed guy with braces...

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: This one was from San Diego.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: She disappeared on a diving trip... in Thailand. Ackerman drops other photographs in front of June...

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: This one died in a parachuting accident. Only she wasn’t wearing a parachute. And this one somehow fell off a moving train.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand... She looks at the photos, horrified, confused.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: The man you helped tonight has been posing as a federal agent in order to lure innocent civilians -- women -- into helping him pull off various national security breaches.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What sort of “breaches?”  32.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: I can't go into it other than to say he usually targets women who are, shall we say, vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: He gets a lot of women over the internet.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (quickly) Well, I don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Miss Holyfield. We need you to tell us where he is.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I have no idea. I just met the guy tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Then why did you take him to the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The man fell on my car. What was I supposed to do, leave him there?

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: No, you were supposed to call the police.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I tried. Look, I have no idea who he is or where he is. But I’m pretty sure that you’re not allowed to just barge into someone’s house and--

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Wake up, Miss Holyfield, this is America. I’m allowed to do whatever is necessary to protect its citizens. Now, did he say anything that could be helpful? '

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (beat) We're gonna be dead for longer than we're gonna be alive. The agents look at each other.  33.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: He also said that he was an undercover agent on a highly sensitive mission.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: And you believed that bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No, of course not. " She sits there feeling like an idiot now.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Miss Holyfield, you were targeted. That means he’s not going to leave you alone. Which means you now need protection. June hugs herself. Jesus. The news keeps getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: I think the best thing for us to do right now would be to hand you over to the local police, let them keep an eye on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June sits in the backseat. “Braces” drives while Ackerman sits shotgun. June looks out the window, shakes her head. She’s broken down.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: This is the first time we've ever gotten to a victim before he... you know. He lets that hang. June thinks about that, looks back out the window. :

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You’re going to Bombeck station? BRACES . Uh, yeah. ;

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Fourth Street’s a better way to go. This will run you into the river-- Ackerman smiles at her.  34.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: We know where we're going. But thank you. And don’t worry... You're safe with us.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: You're safe with us. Okay, now she’s worried. The car SWERVES and she looks up as the Driver enters a m highway, out of town.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about. Just a short cut. You’re safe with us.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You said that already. He turns around smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Because I mean it. June starts breathing heavily. Shit. What to do? Just then, something catches her eye. A placard on the dashboa reads, “CAPRICE.” June thinks for a moment, trying to remember what Milner said. Then she reaches, slowly, quietly, below the seat between her legs. Her hands land on what she’s looking fo June suddenly pulls out the gun. She holds it like it’s o fire, like it’s about to go off in her hands--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (freaking out)

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Okay... easy...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Just pull over.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: June, please, put the gun down before you accidently-—- Suddenly, the WINDSHIELD SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Hey! - JUNE © I didn’t do that! Now another shot takes out a chunk of the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: Ma’am, stop shooting!

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I’m not shooting! She puts the gun down. Another shot slams into the headre

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: THAT’S NOT ME! EXT. FURTHER UP THE HIGHWAY - NIGHT © Milner stands in the middle of the street, a HIGH POWERED RIFLE in his- hands, aiming at the oncoming government sedan... Milner HUMS as he shoots, blows out the front ti of ACKERMAN’S car...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER/HIGH POWERED SCOPE
dialogues.text: In the back of the car freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Smiles. Adjusts his aim. HUMS... Fires...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Braces is shot in the shoulder... June screams. Ackerm opens his door and ROLLS OUT OF THE CAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Milner calmly continues to shoot up the car, which now careens out of control, heads right for him, Milner waits blows out another tire sends the car spinning and now ont its side and all the way over onto the roof...  36. He calmly lowers the rifle as the car slides harmlessly p him, sparks flying from metal scraping on asphalt, coming a stop a hundred feet behind him. Milner walks around the flipped vehicle, notes the GAS leaking out onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June? You alive? He crouches down beside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June- hangs upside down by her seat belt. She slowly look him. He smiles, starts. to reach in and unhook her seatbe

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Let’s get you out of here. The upside down June looks at him, shakily raises the gun his face. He frowns, easily takes the gun away from her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: C'mon, June. Knock it off. (holds up the gun) Rule number one: you don’t ever point a gun at someone unless you intend to use it. Toldja it would come in handy, though, didn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (dazed) The gun kept going off... I wasn’t even shooting... I hate guns... She notices gas leaking all around them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: We should hurry.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, that’s not gonna blow up the car. He pulls her out, calmly talking all the while...

dialogues.speaker: . MILNER
dialogues.text: I felt terrible about just leaving you like that. I’m walking along, all the time thinking, “I told her about the gun, yeah, but what if she doesn’t know how to use it?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps her to her feet and hurries her over to a black parked nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Anyway, then I thought “I can’t leave her alone with Ackerman. I gotta go back,” but by then, you'd already gotten in the car with them which I expressly told you not to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts her into the SUV, then glances back at the car, Braces now crawling away from it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hang on a sec. He pulls out a gun and FIRES at the gas-drenched vehicle. EXPLODES. June jumps.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That’s how you blow up a car. For a moment, the entire road is lit up and Milner sees Ackerman limping off. June is overwrought. This is all too much for her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Uh, June? She just stares at him, her eyes start to close. He gentl taps her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June? She opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hi. You’re in shock. I want you to stay here in the car while I go have a word with Ackerman. Okay? (pulls his gun) I’m just: gonna go shoot him and come right back. nenpnsey: Milner takes off after Ackerman. June watches him go, wai a moment, then quickly throws open the door, gets out of SUV and takes off running through a field on the side of road.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As June just keeps running into town... she loses a shoe. doesn’t stop to pick it up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner races after Ackerman, limping in the distance. He takes aim at him, when several black sedans SCREECH up be the wounded agent. Milner is outnumbered. He makes a hast retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a BUS starts to pull away from the curb--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: Wait! --stops suddenly as June crosses the street directly in f of it, bangs on the door.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Let me in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As June gets on, looks behind her to make sure no one saw her. She walks down the aisle to the back ignoring the stares of the other passengers, who take in this crazy-ey woman scratched up, covered in dirt, missing a shoe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner hurries back to the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay, change of plan... He stops, realizing he is talking to no one. EXT. STREET ABOVE JUNE’S CONDO - LATER NOW SWARMING WITH COPS. June’s NEIGHBORS watch from their condos. June steps into FRAME, out of breath, exhausted. She heads for the nearest cop, his back to her. We HEAR THE RADIO IN A SQUAD CAR as she passes...

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: All units be advised, female suspect, June Louise Holyfield-- June freezes. Looks at the car.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: --wanted in connection with the shooting on Highway 2. Suspect is five foot five, twenty-eight years old... June quietly backs away, hurries along to the next block. And now Milner’s SUV quietly pulls up alongside her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I told you not to leave the car. She keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Now you’ve fled the scene. Your prints are all over your gun...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That’s not my gun!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hey, if you’d trusted me and hung out just another minute or two, I could have helped you clean it up. Now c’mon, get in the car...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I'm not getting in any more cars with anybody.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June-- She stops, turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Look, I know about the other women. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: What “other women?”

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The dead ones. I saw the pictures!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Right. My “victims.” Yeah, that’s one of Ackerman’s favorites. C'mon, June, do I look like a serial killer?  40.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Serial killers never look like serial killers. She starts walking again.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well, you should know that violence to me is always a last resort.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you, John. Or whatever your real name is.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: And the only people I've actually killed-- She stops again. That doesn’t make her feel better.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay, let me put it another way, I’ve never killed any women or children. Not that that hasn’t complicated things in the past, but that’s a rule I live by. She just looks at him, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Serial killer. Man, I can’t believe you fell for that old chestnut--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Just... what do you want?!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Vamos a la playa!

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You want to go to the beach?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I want a fish taco. June resumes walking. He’s insane.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Really, June, I’m starved. We never even ordered dinner...  41.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (indicates the cops down the hill) They're all looking for us and you want to go get Mexican food?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Standard Procedure in this type of situation is to do a Stop-and-Drop.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: A Stop-and-Drop.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Throw off the Pursuit Vectoring Protocols by remaining motionless within the Primary Containment Sphere for at least twenty-seven minutes. That'll keep us off the radar long enough to get on the other side of the I.P.W. (off June’s look) Initial Pursuit Window?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Why is it the more you talk, the less I understand you?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It's simple: they think we’re going out, so we’re going in. (then) c'mon, get in the car, June. She thinks a moment, looks back at her condo, finally wal around the SUV, gets in...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (singing) Vamos a la Playa... EXT. “VAMOS A LA PLAYA” TACO JOINT - DAY A cheesy taco joint off the highway. Milner’s SUV sits in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner leads June into the restaurant. He spots a SECURIT CAMERA on the wall and leads them to a booth that’s out o the camera's view.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: This one’s my favorite booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner digs into his food. June has no appetite. She just glares at him with her arms crossed.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (eating) What'd I tell you? Good, right? She doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Feeling better? She still doesn’t answer. Milner stops eating and sits ba

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay. You have a right to know. Milner reaches into his coat, pulls out his handkerchief, unwraps it to reveal the plastic action figure he dropped into her purse earlier.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: This is what it’s all about.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: It’s all about a Burger King toy? He breaks off the head on the edge of the table, and we s METALLIC OBJECT inside the action figure. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The fate of the world is in the hands of this little baby-- (accidently drops it into the salsa) --shit-- She watches as he pulls it out, wipes it off with his nap

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That's the second time that’s happened--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (impatient) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It’s a battery.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: A battery.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Only not your average Duracell or Eveready. See, someone finally figured out how to convert the water molecule into its component elements -- hydrogen and oxygen. So this battery never runs out. Never ever. Ever. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That’s it? That’s what this is all about? A battery.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That's it? Man, you’re not very politically savvy are you, June? It’s an infinite source of energy... the kind of thing that could render fossil fuels obsolete. And let’s see, what’s the economy based on...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I understand the implications--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The joke is, they’ve had it for a long time now. Maybe ten years. June stares at the battery as he folds it up in the handkerchief again, puts it back in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Too much money still on the table with oil, so they’ve been hiding it until the right time.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Ackerman says you stole it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: He’s right.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So... you did steal it?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: From Ackerman. (leans in close) He’s framing me.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: But you just admitted you stole it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So how could he be framing you?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Because, originally, Ackerman and I were sent to protect it, but then one day I find out he’s made a deal to sell it to the highest bidder, so I took the battery and ran.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: To protect it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: But for Ackerman to save himself, he’s gotta make me the bad guy. I still can’t believe he did it. I mean, he was my partner. That’s supposed to count for something. Milner looks away, suddenly becoming emotional. He actual starts to get teary, quickly becoming wracked with sobs.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s just... I get a little emotional talking about it. I mean, we'd been through a lot together. After that mission in Afghanistan, I thought we really bonded. Hell, I taught him to sand breathe... Milner chokes up again.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (collecting himself) Anyway, that’s why everyone's trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Us. Everyone's trying to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you were seen with me, so they think you know something.  45.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE /
dialogues.text: But I didn’t know anything.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Not then, but you do now.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Because you just told me.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well, you asked.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t. You said, “Okay, here’s what it’s all about.”

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Because you wanted know.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Look, why don’t you just give it back to the government, tell the truth about all of it?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (laughs) Give it back. That’s adorabley June. Tell me, who? Who do I give it back to? I don’t know who to trust. Ackerman clearly had someone on the inside. June shakes her head, looks around the joint.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Right now, I just wanna keep it safe while I figure it all out.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: And I wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Really? Because... I can’t stop thinking about that kiss. (she turns back to him) I just wonder, if maybe I wasn’t so s busy saving the world, maybe you and I couldn’t spend some time getting to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I'm... flattered. Which is kind of pathetic, actually. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNE (cont'd) But, right now, I just really need to go home. Can you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Completely.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Thank you. In one swift motion, Milner PULLS OUT A HUGE GUN, throws into a STRANGLEHOLD, and drags her out of the booth, to o in plain view of the security camera.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Hey-- what’re you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: ALRIGHT EVERYBODY DOWN OR I BLOW
dialogues.text: THIS BITCH’S HEAD OFF!! SCREAMS. Panic. Milner FIRES THREE SHOTS into the air! A light SHATTERS on the floor. Everybody hits the deck. He puts his gun right into June’s cheek. JUNE . Please don’t shoot me! Milner's wild-eyed, crazy.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Don’t make me. Milner fans the gun at the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads down, I mean it! I see a face, I’m gonna blow it away! Milner drags a petrified June towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner backs out of the door, still holding the gun on Ju

dialogues.speaker: AT ME, YOU DIE
dialogues.text: Milner locks the front door of the restaurant then throws keys into the weeds.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner shoves June towards his car, deadly serious--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No way! Milner points the gun at her--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You can ride in the front or you can ride in the trunk. It’s your choice. June slides in, latches her seatbelt, and quickly shuts t door. With that, Milner jumps behind the wheel, and hauls ass o of there. — .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner drives as June stares forward, panicked. Suddenly, Milner starts laughing--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Man, I wish you could’ve seen the look on your face. “Please don’t shoot me.” Your eyes all buggy-- (then) Put you in the trunk... Like I'd do that. I mean, really, June. I told you I’ve never killed a woman before! June goes for the door handle. He snaps, serious--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. June pulls back her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I had to go crazy back there. It was the only way to get you out of trouble. There were security cameras all over. ‘Now there’s hard proof that you're my hostage. June sits a moment in silence. Not sure if she believes h A beat then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ospperne.  48.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It had to look real. And it did... He starts laughing again. She SMACKS him hard across the face.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (impressed) Ouch. Good one. He notices something ahead, goes serious.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Ah, here we go: roadblock. Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You‘re glad? Way up ahead in the distance a ROADBLOCK comes into view, cherries blazing.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well, now that you’re in the clear, you'll be safe with them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Like really safe? Or “they're gonna kill me” safe?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Really safe.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What about Ackerman?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: He's after me. He just wants the battery. He pulls over, reaches across and opens her door. JUNE . You're really letting me go?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Was nice meeting you, Jtine. And I'm really sorry for any trouble I put you through. She starts to get out.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Have a nice life, June. He looks forward, starts to put the car in gear, but sees something in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: . MILNER
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What? Just then, a BLACK OPS HELICOPTER appears out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Stay in the car.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Who are they? The helicopter whips up a tornado of dust.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Shut the door.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What-- aren’t they the cops?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No-— Milner points to the roadblock--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Those are the cops. (pointing to helicopter) These are the bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The FBI guys?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No. Some other bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What other bad guys?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Actually, worse guys.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Worse guys?!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay, listen to me very carefully and do exactly what I say. Here-- He pulls a MACHINE PISTOL out from under the seat.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I need you to take this gun and start shooting at the helicopter. Just keep shooting until it falls out of the sky or explodes. Either one is good. And put on this vest... He hands her a Kevlar vest which she just stares at.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: C’mon, hurry. And, June, this is important: whatever you do, don’t get out of the car. She puts on the vest. Milner throws the car into a 180. The second the car skids to a stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June dives out of the car, scrambles to her feet and star to run like crazy. She waves her arms at the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Help! I’m not with him! I don’t even know him! I'm innocent! They start shooting at her from the helicopter, riddling ground all around her. June runs back to Milner’s car... INT. MILNER’S CAR - SAME -As June dives in...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I‘m with you! I’m with you! Bullets strafe the roof, but don’t make a dent. This gets her attention.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: What did I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Don’t get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: And what did you do?  51.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry! I panicked! Milner throws the car into drive and takes off, heading straight for the roadblock. She holds up the gun...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I can’t shoot at anybody!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Sure you can, you just need a little help... Milner leans over and opens the glove box, pulls out a FL

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Take a shot of this.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Tequila. She knocks back a mouthful from the flask and winces.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I need a lime... June tries to focus as the dashboard opens up and Milner starts going through an array of high tech weapons.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I feel fuzzy-- I mean, funny. She looks at Milner who locks and loads... JUNE . Okay, that wasn’t tequila, was it? She begins to fade in and out of consciousness... EXT. VARIOUS - JUNE’S POV - NIGHT -A MASK is put over June’s pov. -A HELICOPTER catapults towards us out of a giant FIREBAL -MEN WITH GUNS shoot at us, rappelling past the windshiel -Milner yells through his mask, wielding a strange weapon -A POLICE CAR corkscrews through the air, barely missing

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN ON JUNE
dialogues.text: As she wakes up. She’s on a cement floor...

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVAL
dialogues.text: Milner, knife in hand, is fighting several people at once He glances at her...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Just a sec, June-- He then takes them all out, moves towards her just as she ‘passes out again and we... CcuT TO BLACK SOUND OF A HELICOPTER OVER...

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN ON THE INSIDE OF A HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: It’s crashing. Milner is putting a parachute on June...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: We have to hurry! He helps her up...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Jump! And as he PULLS HER out the door, we hear JUNE SCREAM and cut TO BLACK SOUND OF A POWERBOAT...

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: As June wakes up on the boat, Milner at the helm, as they streak across the open ocean. Milner looks back at her, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Almost there. CUT TO BLACK. We hear SEAGULLS. WAVES. FADE IN: MILNER’S HIDE-OUT - TROPICAL ISLAND - DAY June blinks, her eyes adjusting as she sits up on her elb  (53.

dialogues.speaker: THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: Sunflares kick off the water as an out-of-focus silhouett emerges from the sea: it’s Milner in SLO-MO, carrying som diving equipment and two huge lobsters, much like the Mat dot-com ad.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Uh, I missed something. She sits up in a hammock beside a hut, wearing a bikini t and a sarong. Milner holds up the two lobsters--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hey, sleepyhead. I hope you like lobster. June scrambles out of the hammock, stumbles.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You drugged me...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Was for your own good, June. You weren’t really coping all that well and I needed to get us out of there. Milner calmly drops his fins and mask in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Where are we? What are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hiding out, reloading, relaxing. June realizes what she’s wearing.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Uh, okay, Milner--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: C’mon, June. I’ve been trained to dismantle a bomb in the pitch black with nothing but a safety pin and a Junior Mint, I think I can get you in and out of some clothes without looking. (beat) I’m not saying I did that. I’m just saying I could.
He smiles at her and she hits him the face. I mean, reall nails him one, so that he stumbles, drops to one knee. Sh then hurries off down the beach. He touches his jaw, smil

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Wow. He watches her run off, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June storms through the jungle, furious. She ignores the vines and branches that scratch at her and pushes through them to another beach.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Shit. She stands there, looking out a more treacherous stretch coastline. She takes a breath and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the flair of a professional chef, Milner whistles happily as he bastes some fish grilling over coals, then some seasoning. He grates some cheese over some simmering seafood jambalaya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As June makes her way through the marshy terrain. She sli falls into a puddle of mud up to her waist.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Dammit! Suddenly, a heavy TROPICAL DELUGE slams down on her head. June climbs out of the mud-hole, forcing herself forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner expertly squeezes out an icing glaze from an icing atop a few fudge truffles, making delicate swirls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June drags herself along -- soaking wet, exhausted, starv She starts to really panic. It’s getting darker by the minute. She can barely see where she’s going. Like a miracle, she sees something in the distance. She squints into the gloom. Are those torches? She can just make out some kind of structure, built into the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summoning her last gasp of energy, June quickens her pace crawling towards the structure, scrambling up the beach.. She suddenly stops dead as she realizes -- this is the pl she left hours ago. Milner stands there, seasoning a simmering pot over a fire.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Big island, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: If you're going to kill me, just kill me.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I don’t want to kill you. I just want to finish our date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June comes out of the bedroom, showered, wearing the saro like a dress... just as Milner takes a machete and chops coconut in half, hands June a cocktail in it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Here. Very refreshing.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Will it knock me out?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Only if you drink like nine of ‘em. She doesn’t move. He takes a drink. Then passes it to her She takes it, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So... is this your... hideout?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: One of them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: How many places have: you got?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Twelve. No-- eleven, the place in Burma blew up last month. June watches as Milner puts the finishing touches on the exotic meal he’s prepared.  56.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Everything you say seems like such bullshit... I have no clue who you really are.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Part of me being able to do my job is people not knowing who I am.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So am I, like, your hostage?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Not at all. You can leave any time you want. But... He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Why are you in such a hurry to get home?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I have a life. People who depend on me.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The world depends on me. And yet here I am, relaxing. (back to work) Besides, they'll kill you if you go home.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You have the battery. Why would they want to kill me? He sets a plate of beautiful food down in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I was on the run that night, when I saw you sitting there crying, and I have to say, you really moved me.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You told me this--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I dropped the battery in your purse.  57. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: They tracked it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So they think I’m involved.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well, you kinda are involved. (off her look) But I’m ‘gonna get you out of it. (then) C'mon, eat...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You’re an FBI agent. Can’t you just talk to somebody--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I never said I was an FBI agent. I said I was in the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I had to infiltrate the FBI as part of my mission. The truth is, I work for a much more powerful global organization.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The IIA -- International Intelligence Agency.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Never heard of them.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I hope not. If you had, then somebody's not doing their job.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You're telling me you're some kind of super-spy?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well... super’s kind of braggy, but yeah. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILNER (cont'd) Actually, I’m more like a trouble shooter. They point me at trouble and I--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Shoot it?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I was gonna say fix it, but once in a while, yeah, that’s what I have to do. Come on, your food's getting cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You know I find all this a little a little hard to-- oh my God this is good!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No, really, really good. Like “the best thing I’ve ever tasted” good.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Please, you embarrass me. She eagerly devours her meal as Milner looks on.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So what’s your plan?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No plan.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What kind of secret agent doesn’t have a plan?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The smart kind. A plan is just a road map so the bad guys can find me. * But if I don’t know what’s next, then they don’t either.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous. You don’t know what you’re doing, so no one else will know what you’re doing? That’s the dumbest thing I’ve ever heard.  59. Suddenly, an ALARM GOES OFF AND ALL OF THE LIGHTS GO OUT.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Milner looks off, sees LIGHTS in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Huh. How about that? The bad guys found us anyway. Maybe you’re right about the no-plan thing after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner starts grabbing weapons.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Think you’re ready to fire a gun?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I hate guns.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That’s what I thought you’d say. He puts his hand on the back of her neck and squeezes. Sh passes out at his feet. He looks at her lying there on the floor of the hut. He reaches out to touch her hair, but stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Jesus, get a hold of yourself, John. He takes a breath, turns towards the lights.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Asleep. She wakes up. We PULL BACK TO REVEAL that we're..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June, confused, looks up to see MILNER.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Great, you’re awake. C'mon. He helps her up.  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner leads June out the door of a building and leads he down the city street.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (trying to remember) You drugged me again.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Actually, I didn’t drug you. I used a pressure point.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That still counts, I can’t believe you did that again. Didn’t I explicitly tell you not to-- (looks around) What happened to the island? Before them, a flock of pigeons alights to reveal: THE PANTHEON across from them. June stares up at it. . She’s never seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Welcome to Rome.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. She’s in awe. Milner puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: First time, huh? Always the best. Milner leads her away. She looks around at the various sites. Can't believe her eyes. Can’t believe she’s here.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: There’s someone here I can give the battery to.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Name’s Salvatore Russo. Bigtime environmentalist, philanthropist. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: —  61. MILNER (cont'd) Brilliant. Squeaky clean. Powerful friends. There’s no way he'd let the battery get into the wrong hands.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Never met him before... but he’s going to be at an environmental .summit reception tonight. I thought we’d crash. Then I’m gonna take you to the embassy, get your name cleared. Send you home. She stops cold, looks over his shoulder. Ackerman’s numbe two, the big read head, loiters across the street, preten to look in a shop window. His ARM IS IN.A SLING.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: What--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Don’t turn around.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: One of Ackerman’s guys... the big Howdy Doody lookalike with braces.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I shot him. Didn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Well, he’s here.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Just keep walking. Milner ducks into an alley. Presses June up against a wal They wait, up close like this, and a moment later the age walks by, but doesn’t look down the alley...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You're right. That’s him. (looks at June) Nice get, June. They stay close for a moment. Look at each other.  62.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: We should probably wait here a few extra minutes, just to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just to be safe. A nice moment. The nice moment is broken, however, when a GUN is put into Milner’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding his gun to Milner’s head.

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: Small world. Ciao, Milner.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That means “good-bye,” shithead.

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Actually, it’s like aloha, you can say it either coming or going...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (smiles at June) You're full of surprises.

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: Whatever. You move and it’s aloha to your fuckin brains.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (looks into June’s eyes) I’m happy right where I am. She smiles at him. And suddenly, Braces cries out as she kicks the man hard in the shin. Milner, still looking at June, elbows him in the face and now June kicks him again this time in that higher spot that bends a man over. Milner takes June by the hand and they take off running.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I think aloha can also mean “I love you.”  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
