dialogues.text: As Milner and June duck inside. Milner looks out the wind satisfied they're not being followed he turns to June...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Very nice. I’m impressed. But June’s gone. He sees that she’s wandered off, taking the beautiful clothing...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Gianni? June looks over as a pretty young SALESGIRL comes over an embraces Milner.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: “Gianni?” They begin conversing in Italian. Milner is fluent and ke up with her. She laughs at a joke he tells, notices a now self-conscious June standing there.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Oh... yeah, I need you to make her even prettier than she is.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Do, I have to?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Yes... and make sure she gets to this address by eight o'clock. June, blown away by Milner’s linguistic skill, watches as scribbles on a card, then hands the girl a BLACK AMEX.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: (eyeing June) I'm very jealous, Gianni.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Don't worry-- (kisses the girl on the cheek) It's just business. The Salesgirl nods, “Ah.” June looks hurt -- she’s learne enough Italian to translate Milner’s words: “It’s just business.”

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (to the Salesgirl) Grazie. The Salesgirl follows Milner over to June.

dialogues.speaker: / MILNER
dialogues.text: Elisa will take good care of you while I go run some errands, get ready for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Pick out whatever you want. I'll see you in a few hours. Milner exits. June looks around the store, overwhelmed. T Salesgirl nods for her to follow... :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noisy residential neighborhood. Milner gets out of a ta looks up at an apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner climbs the steps, pulls out his gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Milner comes to a door, knocks.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It’s me. The door opens to the limit of the chain and we see THE R HEAD WITH BRACES peering through the crack. Finally--

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: You're an asshole. He shuts the door, takes off the chain and re-opens it.

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: First you shoot me, then you kick me in the nuts. What’s up with that?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It was June who kicked you. And she saw you. She’s not stupid... Little uptight maybe, but not stupid. (looks into the apartment) You alone in there?

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: It’s all clear. Milner puts his gun away, follows Braces inside.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Everything set?

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: Good to go.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Where’s Ackerman?

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: At the embassy. What’s up with the girl, really?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: She’s just a civilian.

dialogues.speaker: BRACES
dialogues.text: She doesn’t kick like one. Milner smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner stands at the top of the steps, wearing a perfectl cut tux. He watches as a limo pulls up. The DRIVER gets out, holds the door open for June, a knockout in her new evening gown. Milner walks down the steps to meet her. Al business...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s go. He takes her arm, but she stays put. He looks back at her

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: This is the part where you tell me how beautiful I look.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Do you really need to hear it?  66. He gestures to the crowd and sure enough, everyone is loo at her. He starts leading her up. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Let’s go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter and Milner immediately grabs an hors d’oeuvre a passing tray.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Grazie. (eats) I’m starving. They look around, take in the scene which is basically a of OVERWEIGHT MEN in tuxedoes with BEAUTIFUL WOMEN who ma may not be their wives. on their arms. Imagine a room ful Karl Roves standing amongst beautiful art and you’re ther JUNE. How are we gonna find Russo in this crowd?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (looking at her) He'll find us. A TANGO starts and Milner leads her towards the dance flo

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s dance.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Milner, I don’t dance. Well, I dance, but-- (gesturing to the dance floor) —-just not like that. She watches them all tango.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You can’t be a spy if you don’t know ‘how to tango.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t tango.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: All right. We’ll just have to mix it up a little.  67. June watches as Milner pulls the BAND LEADER aside and sl him some money. The tango comes to an abrupt end. The confused dancers stop. Milner moves June to middle of the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Just try your best to keep up. The band launches into lively SALSA MUSIC. Milner expertly starts salsa dancing. June grins -- she expertly keeps pace with him, dancing with surprisingly sultry rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (wowed ) Okay, this was way better than a tango. The crowd looks on, impressed. Others start dancing as we

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So how’s Russo going to find us?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: He already has. (looks off) The white-haired guy with the thick glasses. He’s looking at you, isn’t he? Milner grabs June and dips her low to the ground. She loo at Russo, upside down, giving him a great shot of her cleavage.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Milner pulls her back up.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: All those Nobel prizes and he still needs to be with the prettiest girl in the room.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You don’t look half bad yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: neaeese.  68. He grabs her, dips her again, looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That's the first nice thing you've said since we met.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Must be the Stockholm Syndrome talking.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Not bad for a first date, eh?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Is that what this still is? They look at each other, as the moment gets awkward...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So... how you want to approach him?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I’m not. You are. Milner spins June around and pulls her back in.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hit me.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You did it before.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I was mad at you before. I’m not mad at you now.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay. I don’t know what to go with -- the fact that you actually had z to use the internet to get a date 3 or that you look like you've somehow gained eight pounds since I met you. : BAM! June slaps Milner really hard.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Now act upset.  69.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I am upset!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Good, now I need you to go to the little girls room, and when Russo finds you, tell him you wanna meet him on the terrace in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Screw you!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Look, you don’t have to kiss him or anything, just--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I’m acting upset.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Oh. Nice. She then grabs a drink from a passing tray and throws it Milner’s face.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay, June--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (slaps him again) I’m in the moment. June walks off “in a huff” as Milner looks around at the other DANCERS, who are staring. He makes the internationa sign for “crazy.”

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Pazza. Loca. They don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Americana. Everyone nods, understanding, as we CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As June approaches the ladies room, Russo appears. He's tall, the lights reflected in his thick glasses.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: May I be of some assistance?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (not making it easy, reaches for the door) I think I can manage.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: So I saw. She pauses, looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Bathroom attendant?

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: (extends his hand) Salvatore Russo. And I'd be very disappointed if I wasn’t given a chance to get to know you better.

dialogues.speaker: . JUNE
dialogues.text: It's your party. Try if you want to. She realizes.just how lame that sounded, tries not to win

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: Clever. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: June.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: Tell me, June, what did your friend say that you found so offensive?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: He compared me to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: Unforgivable. How ‘bout I find a couple glasses of Champagne, meet you on the terrace in, say, fifteen . 3 minutes? s

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Make it five. She walks away, Russo watching every lovely step.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PARTY
dialogues.text: She looks around for Milner. He comes up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well done. (hands her a key) I’1l meet you back at the apartment. You better get going.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Right now? But I’m all dressed up.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (takes her in) Yes, you are. And it’s just fine with me if you stay that way until I get back. But this next part, I gotta do alone. And I don’t wanna be distracted like I am right now.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So I'm distracting...?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Go on, get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June skips down the steps, smiling. She feels confident, looks great. As she hits the bottom step, TWO MENACING FIGURES with buzz-cuts appear in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: MENACING FIGURE
dialogues.text: June Holyfield?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (beat) I‘m afraid you have the wrong person. She tries to walk around him. The man steps in front of h

dialogues.speaker: MENACING FIGURE
dialogues.text: Get in the car. He opens his jacket to reveal A BIG GUN.

dialogues.speaker: MENACING FIGURE
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russo stands alone by the balustrade, optimistically hold two flutes of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Salvatore... Russo, startled, turns to see Milner standing before him.

dialogues.speaker: . MILNER
dialogues.text: E piacevole vederli ancora. Russo breaks out into a grin.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: And you, Milner. Are you here on business or pleasure this time?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Little of both. I’ve got something for you. .

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO
dialogues.text: (eagerly) The battery?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No, unfortunately. Something else. Milner reaches into his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two’menacing men escort June out of the car and whisk into the building past US MARINES, who stand at attention

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June's heels ECHO on the marble floor as she’s led down t imposing hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June enters to see a WOMAN, typing on her computer, her b to June.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: 18,500 Euros. That was quite the shopping spree you had today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman turns around to face June.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I‘m FBI Director Isabelle George.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Look, this whole thing is just a big misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Which part of aiding and abetting a known enemy of the state am I not understanding?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You’re talking about the battery. Milner’s just trying to keep it safe.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Really? Director George stands up.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Four days ago, Milner was given strict orders to bring it in, but he never showed up. Since then, he‘s been trying to arrange an international auction to sell it to the highest bidder. _ JUNE. No, that’s what Ackerman is doing! Director George presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: I assume Milner told you Ackerman was rogue FBI? Ackerman steps out of an inner door, startling June.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: But the truth is he’s my best field agent. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June stares at Ackerman, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ask yourself, Ms. Holyfield: Has Milner said one thing that you can prove to be true?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (to Ackerman) He said you were going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Yet here you are. June doesn’t know what to say. DIRECTOR GEORGE ° Now, it’s time you started telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I am. Look, Milner’s not a bad guy. He’s just working undercover for the ITA. Director George and Ackerman stare at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The International Intelligence Agency. You know, it’s a big, top- secret, international spy... thing... Director George and Ackerman exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ms. Holyfield, I have a security clearance unrivaled by anyone else on the planet. And I’ve never heard of any organization by that name.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (getting worried) Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: What I have heard of is the New Freedom Coalition. What has Milner told you about them?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The-- Nothing--

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: We know that they’re trying to destabilize the Middle East--  75.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Isn't it already pretty unstable?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: They're going after our allies, the Saudis, the Kuwaitis, the UAE...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Milner’s never said a word about the New... whatever--

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: --Freedom Coalition. Yet you attended one of their events tonight...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: We know they’re raising money for something. I want to know what.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Milner just wanted to meet a guy named Salvatore Russo to give him the battery.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Give him the battery? Would you like to see what he actually gave Mr. Russo? She indicates a video monitor. Ackerman switches on a surveillance tape of

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: Milner stands with Russo on the roof as in the previous scene.- Milner reaches into his jacket pocket... then pul gun and shoots Russo dead. June watches the tape, horror-struck.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No... that’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: He’s still in possession of the battery. You see, he’s lied to you again. What are you up to, Ms.. Holyfield?  76.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Nothing... I’m just...

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: The last time I saw you, you said you had nothing to do with Milner.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I didn’t-- I just met him-- Director George hits the remote again and we see security camera footage of June with Russo...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: How ‘bout I find a couple glasses of Champagne, meet you on the terrace in, say, fifteen minutes?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSO, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: Make it five.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Okay, that was just me being in the moment-— They both just look back at her.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: I gotta say, from where we stand, you're starting to look a lot less like an innocent bystander and a lot more like Milner’s partner. JUNE . You have no proof-- (then) Besides the tape I mean.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: The proof is you’re still alive. June shifts nervously in her seat as Ackerman sits down c to her.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: I wonder, what is it you have that Milner wants?  77.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Well, for some reason, he seems. to trust you. So here’s what you're going to do: the next time you get a visual on the battery, you'll give us a signal, and we'll take it from there.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: With all due respect, you’re making a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: (losing patience) Here’s the deal, Miss Holyfield. You’re looking at life in a prison that technically doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I want a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Too bad. You can’t have one. Life as you know it is now over. You may think you’re in Rome, but if you decide not to cooperate with us, you were never in Rome or anywhere else for that matter. Because contrary to what you may believe, this world is flat and you can fall off the edge.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: And that’s if Milner doesn’t kill you first. And make no mistake, when he’s ready, he will kill you. June reels. Thinks a moment. Ackerman sets a BLACK BALL- POINT pen down on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: It’s both a bug and a transmitter. Once Milner’s... compromised, click the pen three times and we'll come knocking on the door.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Three times... don’t I have to say “There's no place like home” first? No one laughs. She sighs, picks up the pen, stares at it.  78.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: As long as you have the pen, we'll hear everything, so you'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: And if I do this?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: You get your life back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As June considers the PEN Director George gave her. She drops it into her clutch, looks out the window as the cab passes the Trevi Fountain, couples sitting there, kissing June looks out, turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June gets out of the cab, stares up at the building. She takes a breath, starts for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June walks in as Milner makes a cappuccino from a machine

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: There you are! I was starting to get worried.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Just doing a little sightseeing.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (hands her cup) Here. You haven’t had a cappuccino until you’ve had one in Rome. He turns away and starts to prepare another cappuccino fo himself as she sits and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So... did you find Russo?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: How did it go?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Good, not great.  79.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: But you gave him the battery, right?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Not exactly. June’s face falls, but Milner doesn’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So you’ve still got it.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I didn’t trust him after all.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Do you trust anybody?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It’s my job not to. Hey, what do you say we take a little break tomorrow and check out the Colosseum? He sits across from her.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You have no intention of handing over the battery to anyone, do you?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Not until it’s safe.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: When will it be safe, John?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I’1ll know it when I feel it. June stares at him and makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Let me see it again.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The battery. If you really still have it, then show me. Milner hesitates, then reaches into his pocket and places battery on the table before them.  80.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Hard to believe a thing that small could ruin so many lives. CLOSE ON June’s hand behind her back, clicking the ball-p pen. Milner stares back at her, then looks at his cup. We see what he sees: the cappuccino begins to tremble ever so slightly. He shakes his head, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It hurts a lot more than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (concerned) What?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The knife you just stuck in my back.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You knew?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It’s my job to know.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Don’t pretend to be hurt. It’s all “just business” to you, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No. Not when it comes to you. He looks sincere. June’s uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You killed him. How could you just do that?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: He was starting to suspect me. He was going to compromise my mission. It was either his life or millions of others. I had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I just want out, Milner. I don’t know who to believe anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never wanted you to believe me, June. I just wanted you to trust me. Milner takes the battery and puts it back in his pocket, walks to a door, takes out a key, and opens it to reveal WEAPONS CACHE inside -- guns of all shapes and sizes. He arms himself, then looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I should've left you in the car with Ackerman. I should've never come back for you. Suddenly, the windows in the apartment explode and the ro starts to fill with GAS.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner and June burst through the door.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: C’mon!

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? I’m not going with you.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You'll be safer.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No, I won’t.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Yes, you will. A SWAT TEAM emerges from the staircase at the end of the hallway and starts SHOOTING at both of them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (pissed, to Milner) Don’t say it. Milner fires back at the SWAT team and shoves June out a window, onto a fire escape.  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner joins June. As they start to hurry down, GUNMAN sh up at them from the street below.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Wrong way. They start going up instead, the SWAT TEAM following them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner pulls June off the fire escape onto the rooftop an starts running, holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hang on! June’s eyes go wide as she realizes -- this is a running start. They race towards the edge of the building... and jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They land, rolling on the roof and scrambling to their fe As the SWAT TEAM reaches the other rooftop and fires at t they take cover behind a concrete barrier. Milner returns fire, a gun in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: These are the kind of moments I’m not going to miss.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Just stay calm. The barrier above them explodes in gunfire. He fires off. few shots.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No, I won't stay calm. Because normal people don’t stay calm in situations like this.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I'm calm. Are you implying I'm not normal?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh, no, you’re completely normal. Just your average, everyday borderline sociopath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires off a few more shots. ‘

dialogues.speaker: " MILNER
dialogues.text: That hurts, June. Deeply.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh, that is so you. You know what your problem is? You repress all your feelings until they just explode out of you in fits of spontaneous crying or the need to shoot something. You’re damaged, Milner.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You want to talk about my emotional state? Fine. Let’s talk. He. lays down his guns on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I may not wallow in my feelings and cry during chick flicks like most people, but it’s because I don’t have that luxury. Bullets fly all around them. June gets nervous.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I understand. Absolutely. Could you pick up the guns, please?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Do you understand, June? Really? Because I have the fate of the free world in my hands. That means my judgment can’t be impaired by the constant randomness of emotions. More bullets fly.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Can we just put a pin in this for now?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: See, my job entails a little more than just getting people coffee in the morning. That gets to her.  84. JUNE . How dare you! Just because I don’t kill anybody in my job doesn’t mean it’s not important.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I‘m not saying it’s not important. I‘m just saying you’re capable of a hell of a lot more. x

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t need career advice from an emotional cripple!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s it! You want your life back? Fine! He takes out the battery and shoves it in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: This is what they want. She looks at him, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Give it to them. Tell them you stole it off me.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Milner--

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You wanna go home? Get your life back? This is the only way. Take it. And your passport... Milner pulls out her passport and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: At least you got one stamp. He grabs his guns off the ground, then shoots his way ove the roof‘s ledge. He gives her one last look, then leaps over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June hurries to the ledge to see him land on top of a pas bus. He rises to his feet on the roof of the moving bus, then jumps off onto a DELIVERY GUY on a Vespa, knocking him ov  85.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (to the Delivery Guy) Sorry, man. He hops on the Vespa and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Director George, Ackerman, and other agents burst through stairway door.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to the agents) Hold your fire! She crosses to June.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Are you alright, Ms. Holyfield?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (looking after Milner) I don’t know. She holds out the battery.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I stole it from him. Director George looks at her, gently takes it from her ha

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: You did-the right thing. It’s over. Director George hands the battery to Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: Get it to DC. And try to hold on to it this time. Ackerman nods, then tucks the battery into his coat pocke

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR GEORGE
dialogues.text: (re: June) Let’s get her on a plane home. EXT. JUNE’S CONDO - DAY As a cab pulls away and June stands there looking at the place. She takes a’ breath, starts up the walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JUNE'’S CONDO - NIGHT June washes the single dish, single glass... INT. OFFICE - JUNE’S FLOOR - MORNING June sets the coffees and baked goods on various desks, t straps herself into her own desk. A co-worker enters, see her...

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Hey, June.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Morning, Ronnie. I left you a soy latte -- non fat, no sugar -- on your desk and I’m sorry about the last few days...

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Oh... (holds up a coffee) I already got one, but thanks. And what’re you sorry for? She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Well, I wasn’t here and-- And now ANOTHER CO-WORKER sits down.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Really? You tock some time off, huh? June stands there, wounded, as the realization hits her - no one noticed she was gone. She looks over at the 50-something woman, sitting down to work at her cubicle, her desk clock beside her. The woman sees June staring at it.

dialogues.speaker: 50-SOMETHING WOMAN
dialogues.text: (re: desk clock) It’s already broken.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That’s too bad.

dialogues.speaker: 50-SOMETHING WOMAN
dialogues.text: Eh, it was good while it lasted. So where'd you go?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What? Oh. Italy. And some tropical island... somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: 50-SOMETHING WOMAN
dialogues.text: (impressed) Ooo! Why’d you come back? June considers it. Good question. InT. HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Milner sits at a table, putting together explosive device and wiring detonators. He speaks to someone O.S.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: She actually accused me of being an emotional cripple. You ever heard anything more ridiculous? TI told her, emotional detachment is a necessary part of the job. But it's like she didn’t even hear it. How can she drive me so nuts? I swear, I've been off my game since the moment I met her. (then, considering) Still, I guess the question is why do I do the job in the first place, you know? And the truth is, it’s all I’ve got. That’s why I can do it so well... because I don’t have anything else to care about. When you don’t have anybody, you've got nothing to lose, right? (then, realizing) But if I’ve been off my game, and I have... maybe it’s because I’ve finally found something I don’t want to lose. He gathers up the devices in a backpack.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I really appreciate you letting me talk this out with you. Thanks, man. We WIDEN to see that Milner has been talking to a huge THUGGISH GUY who is tied to a chair, bound and gagged.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You’re a good listener. He punches the guy in the face, knocking him unconscious.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June sits down at the bar in the restaurant where she and Milner first met. The BARTENDER steps over.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: White wine, please. She looks over to the empty table where she sat with Miln

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Actually, make it a bourbon. He pours her a drink. She downs it quickly, then passes t glass back to him.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Another. He pours her another. She sits there, feeling out of sort She pulls out her passport and opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: At least I got one stamp. She examines the stamp, when a puzzled look crosses her f

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PASSPORT
dialogues.text: It's not an Italian stamp, but a stamped picture of an IG and, beneath it, the numbers “64 14 23 153 37 03.”

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Milner... (to the bartender) Hey, these numbers mean anything to you? She shows them to him.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Phone number? Lotto pick?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Thanks. She throws down some cash and hurries out. INT. JUNE’S BEDROOM - DAY June looks at the numbers on her passport and does a Goog search on her laptop. She comes up empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the numbers in the passport again, gets an i

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Wait... She goes to a geographical locator website and types in t numbers.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Longitude 64, 14, 23. Latitude \ 153, 37, 03. The site displays the coordinates as a dot on a map -- a remote location in northern Alaska. She smiles. That‘s it MONTAGE - JUNE’S TRANSFORMATION -- June walks through her office carrying a box of her belongings. Her co-workers and a confused Mr. Hearn look as she strides into the elevator and leaves. -- At a bank, June sits at a desk with a BANKER. He hands her a thick stack of bills. She shakes his hand and leave He turns to his computer, where we see his screen display “HOLYFIELD, JUNE” with the words "CHECKING,” “SAVINGS”, “A01K," and “IRA” beneath. With a click of his mouse, the word “CLOSED” appears beside each one. -- At_a newsstand, June snaps up copies of Eye Spy, Guns Ammo, Future Weapons. She’s about to leave, when she doub back, grabbing Cosmo. -- In her apartment, June tosses her various tasteful-yet bland outfits from her closet into onto a large pile in t middie of her floor. Finally, she stands in the closet amidst empty racks. She looks determined. -- In a department store, June tries on various “spy” out with no luck -- one’s too bulky, the next too “army surpl another too constricting, etc. CLOSE ON JUNE’S FACE She smiles. Whatever she’s wearing now, that’s the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF SLEEK BOOTS struts confidently through the terminal. PAN UP to see it’s June, decked out in a sexy, super-spy outfit, impenetrable behind dark sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June owns it, the CROWD parting as she passes. Heads turn She's intense, deadly determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a boarding announcement.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE WORKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is the final boarding call for Anchorage, Alaska, departing from Gate 7-B. . June heads for the gate, passing a SINISTER-LOOKING MAN turned away from her, buying a slice of pizza. He turns around and stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airplane soars over the frozen Alaskan landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June emerges from the terminal, a bag slung over her shoulder. She heads for the taxi stand, when a SCARY-LOOK guy steps up beside her.

dialogues.speaker: SCARY GUY
dialogues.text: Need a ride, miss? JUNE . No, thanks. I‘11 just take a cab. Two other equally SCARY-LOOKING guys step up beside her, her in. They show her they’re holding guns under their coats. She sighs wearily.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You guys just love your guns, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They herd her into a waiting black sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are back where we were in the first scene. June’s seat at a metal table, handcuffed, as the Scary Guys stand menacingly nearby. June just sits there, thinking in sile -- having replayed the whole story of her past week solel her mind. The Scary Guys wait expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You said you’d have to go back to Monday to explain to us why you’re here. So do it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. You know what? I'm not feeling it.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t know if you’re the bad guys or the worse guys or some other guys entirely. But the one thing I do know for certain? You’re definitely a bunch of assholes. The Man looks on, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Honestly, if this was last week, we might be having a whole different conversation here. But a lot’s happened to me since then. So, really, I only have two words for you... bite me. The Man nods to one of his cohorts, who grabs June’s arm, rolls up her sleeve. She stares in horror as she’s inject with a needle.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What is that? Heroin?! Is that heroin?! You're gonna turn me into a junkie?!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: It’s sodium pentothal. To relax you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (sagging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you can tell us your story -- completely and truthfully.’ June sits there a moment, the drug hitting her. the man.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The truth?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (leaning forward) Yes. The truth.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Okay. My mother has a better life than I do.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I mean, I always thought she was just irresponsible, ever since I was a kid, and I didn’t want to be like that. I went the other way -- played it safe and stable, you know? But that’s no fun. And it is so not sexy.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Miss Holyfield-- I need to know-- 92. She looks at We hear. GUNSHOTS OS and now the sound of MEN scurrying a More GUNSHOTS. SOMEONE SCREAMS. The Man barks something in Russian and other men in the d spring into action. But June does something strange. She smiles. Lights up. Because...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: It's him--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: More GUNPLAY and now we see muzzle flashes in the dark. T Russian Man, the last man in here, is panicked, reloads h gun. She looks at him, giggles...  93.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (sing-song) He's gon-na ki-il you...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Quiet! BOOM! And he’s shot. And now SILENCE. A switch is flipped and the space lights up. Revealing Milner standing there the door, inside A GIANT WAREHOUSE-LIKE SPACE.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You came for me. That is so romantic... He starts to untie her. She smells his hair. Weird.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I was really hoping to get to you before these guys did. Sorry about “that. He starts to lead her out of there...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I’d be mad at you if I didn’t want to rip your clothes off so bad... (takes his arm) Boy, you‘ve got big biceps. I really wanna see you naked... Can

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Uh-huh, so exactly what did they shoot you up with?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Sodium something.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Sodium pentothal?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: That’s the one.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That‘s truth serum, June. ’

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The truth is I feel so _ good... Except now she starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Why did I waste so much of my life?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: And all those guys I dated. Mitch, Dave... Todd... Keith. They’re all the same -- boring. Boring, boring, boring! As gunshots rip into the wall, Milner pulls her back...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Careful...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: But not you... you are so exciting. You have such an exciting life. (grabs him) You really excite me, Milner. John. He looks at her, checks his gun. Then jumps out and shoot the gunmen down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: All clear...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: And you’re so brave. That really excites me, too. How brave you are. And you care about the world... do you have any idea how that makes me feel?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (checks around a corner) Excited? t JUNE Alive. He shoots two men coming down the corridor, pulls her along...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: But would it work between us? Oh, I’m sure the sex would be good. Really good. Like really excellent good--  95.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: It’s a good thing you're not gonna remember any of this--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: --But then what? Another gunman, behind them, Milner pivots, shoots over June’s head...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You work alone and live alone. So in the end, I’d be... alone, right? A GRENADE rolls down the corridor... Milner quickly throw his body against a door, crashes into...

dialogues.speaker: AN OFFICE
dialogues.text: Pulling June to the floor as the explosion rips through t corridor... They lie on the floor together, she looks at

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t even know who you are. I mean, not really. Milner stands, pulls her to Her feet, picks up metal desk chair, throws it through the window as June prattles on.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I mean, sure, you’re obviously suave and smart and you've great taste in clothes. Except for your shoes. Milner looks offended.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with my shoes? These are Ferragamo.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Don’t go with the outfit.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Yes, they do!

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: The point is, I don’t know if you -can have ever anyone else in your life. But I guess we should just enjoy the time we’ve got together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her up to the window... she starts to climb out, looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: And you are really sexy. GUNSHOTS RIP INTO THE OFFICE... MILNER. Go! She goes out the window and Milner turns around flips ove the desk, gets behind it and takes out the two GUNMEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIGHT SUN as Milner hurries June away from the remote warehouse, which we now see is in the midst of an icy wilderness. Milner hops on a waiting snowmobile, pulls th groggy June on behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Hold on. June wraps her arms around him as he fires up the snowmob and speeds away. She rests her head against Milner’s back smiling blissfully, then closes her eyes and drifts off t sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through binoculars, someone watches Milner and June speed away on the snowmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An isolated, military-like compound sits hidden away amid the snowy mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June awakens, looks around to find herself in a well- appointed bedroom -- satin sheets, tasteful furniture, et She takes in the strange surroundings and grins. She’s getting used to this. On a nightstand next to her lies a handwritten note. She picks it up. It reads: “JUNE, STAY PUT. BUT IF YOU CAN’T, THERE’S A MACHINE GUN IN THE DRAWER. -- XOXO, MILNER”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the drawer to reveal a MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June emerges from the bedroom, holding the machine gun tentatively. She makes her way down the hall, when she he MALE VOICES approaching down an adjoining hallway up ahea She ducks for cover in a doorway as the BURLY GUYS walk p then stealthily continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stand by a doorway leading into a main hall. She pee inside. It’s filled with INTERNATIONAL BUSINESSMEN and DI CHENEY-TYPES. Just then, she hears a DEEP VOICE right beh her.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?! June whirls around, raises her machine gun. It’s just Milner, doing a voice. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Don‘t do that.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Sorry. You know, for a woman who hates guns, you look pretty hot packing one. She hands the machine gun to him.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. We're safe with my peeps.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Your “peeps”? You mean the IIA?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The whats-it? (then, remembering) Ohhh... Actually, I kinda made that up. I’m talking about my real peeps. Come on, I’1l introduce you... He leads her into the adjoining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gathered INTERNATIONAL BUSINESSMEN smile warmly at Mi and June as the two enter.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June, may I present the New Freedom Coalition -- or the NFC, for short. Not to be confused with the National Football Conference, who, for the most part, have no aspirations of global domination. Milner pulls her hand from him, then turns to a SCIENTIST MILNER (CONT’D) This is Dr. Raj. He's reverse- engineering the battery for us. Milner pulls the battery out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (confused) But... you gave me the battery. Milner looks sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Busted! Sorry, June. That was a fake. I had to get the real one up here ASAP so we could move on to Phase Two.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Phase Two?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Production. He sets the battery down on a table.

dialogues.speaker: DR. RAJ
dialogues.text: We're going to make thousands of them.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: And here's the kicker. Once we start the big war in the Middle East and choke off the world’s oil supply -- BAM! -- we appear with the solution. We’re going to be bazillionaires. (then) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILNER. (cont'd) I know that’s not really a number, but when we’re in charge, we’ll make it one.-

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: DR. RAJ
dialogues.text: My dear, it’s very simple. Once we destabilize the global economy, we can use our power to build a better world.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Sure, there might be a little widespread panic and general mayhem. But you can’t make a “free- world frittata” without breaking a few eggs, right? The others chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Why did you bring me here?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You helped us throw off the FBI, Ackerman, the worse guys, and God- knows-who-else. You’ve proven yourself. We want you in the club. He takes her hands, earnestly. .

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I want you in the club. I always knew you were meant for great things. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I come all this way around the world to find you -- and this is who you are?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June, think about it. The world is falling apart. We’re offering mankind a second chance. These are the good guys.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: No. These are just a bunch of twisted, greedy, evil assholes. And you’re one of them.  100. The other NFC members exchange worried glances.

dialogues.speaker: DR. RAJ
dialogues.text: Milner, do we have a problem here?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (waves them off) We’re cool, we're cool... June, I have to say, you’re being. just a liiiittle bit ungrateful. Think about this. I mean, really think about it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. RAJ
dialogues.text: Milner... Milner sighs wearily.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You disappoint me, June. He pulls a gun and points it at her. She’s defiant.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Go ahead. It’s really been “just business” to you all along, hasn't it? Milner stares her down coldly, his gun steady, his finger tightening on the trigger, when they hear the sound of a ROCKET PROPELLED GRENADE being fired.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (realizing) Ackerman. Get down! A missile hits the room and EXPLODES. All hell breaks loo Everyone’s sent sprawling to the floor as the lights go o debris falls from the ceiling, etc. nm June takes advantage of the distraction. She grabs the battery off the floor and races out the door. Milner notices.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June! He goes after her as a KLAXON blares.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June turns a corner and races down the hallway. Milner ru after her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: June, wait!

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June bursts out onto the huge balcony, built against the mountainside. The view is breathtaking, the drop-off over the railing hundreds of feet to the ground below. . Milner is in pursuit. June heads for a’door across the balcony, but stops short when she sees --

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Bursting through the doorway ahead, gun drawn, aiming at Milner. She ducks between two large columns to get out of the lin fire. . Ackerman shoots as Milner dives for cover. Bullets fly in both directions on the balcony before her, the two men engage in a fierce gun battle. She puts the battery in her pocket, desperately looks around for a way out. There are no other exits. She stands there, at a los when -- She hears the sound of a CLANK, CLANK on the floor nearby

dialogues.speaker: A LIVE
dialogues.text: Skitters to a stop right before her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (sees it) Great. June desperately reaches out for the grenade, trying to s protected from the firefight. Her fingers finally land on it. She CHUCKS it towards Milner’s end of the balcony, then d back between the columns as the grenade EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner loses his gun in the blast, debris raining down on him. Between the columns, June waits nervously. Ackerman steps before her.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: _ Ms. Holyfield?

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: A bloodied MILNER hits him from the side, knocking Ackerm gun from his hands. The two men tear into each other. June picks up.Ackerman’ gun off the floor, as Milner and Ackerman’s brawl SLAMS t against the balcony’s railing. Damaged by the grenade, th railing gives way. Milner lies half over the side of the balcony, with Acker on top of him, his fingers locked around Milner’s throat. June pulls Milner’s gun from the debris. Milner struggles to free himself from Ackerman’s chokehol then kicks him off, sending him flying across the balcony As the two men stagger to their feet, ready to continue t battle -- :

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: June steps between them, her arms spread wide, a gun in e hand, aiming at the two men in both directions.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Just... stop.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Easy there, June. You hate guns, remember?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You know what I hate more? Liars!

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Ms. Holyfield, I’m here with the FBI. We tracked Milner and the NFC here to shut them down for good.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit, June. He’s not here with the FBI. He’s here with his clients -- the Worse Guys. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILNER (cont'd) They want the battery to power weapons. The kind that can fit in a suitcase. —

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: So what? You’re with the other bad guys!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: No, I’m not! I swear to you! I just infiltrated the NFC as part of my mission.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: That’s absurd. Don’t fall for it!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That's why I left you the stamp in your passport. I knew Ackerman and his clients would follow you here. Do you know how hard it is to get all the bad guys in the same place? June is skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: Ms. Holyfield, listen to me. We’ll get you out of here. You can still go back to your old life. For God's sake, don’t let him use you again. . It sounds convincing. June is torn.

dialogues.speaker: . MILNER
dialogues.text: June... you know the real reason I chose you when I saw.you in the window of that restaurant? Because you looked lonely. And I know what lonely looks like.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: He’s trying to get inside your head. That’s what he does. Don’t ‘let him!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You were wrong, June. What you said when the worse guys drugged you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Uh... what did I say?  104.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: That I could never have anyone in my life. That if we got together, you'd wind up alone.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I said that?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Well, that and you think that we'd have great sex, but let’s stay on target--

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I did not say that.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: The point is, you’re all I’ve been able to think about, ever since I met you.. You’re the best partner I've ever had, in every conceivable way.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Just-- what do you want, Milner?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I want this first date to go on forever. She looks: him in the eyes a beat -- he’s never looked mo serious. She makes her decision.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (to Milner) I don’t believe you... Milner looks wounded. Ackerman smiles in relief.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (to Milner) ..-but I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoots Ackerman, then goes to Milner. He takes her in his arms, just as -- :

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF ARMED WORSE GUYS
dialogues.text: Step out onto the balcony. Ackerman, clutching his gunsho wound, calls to them.

dialogues.speaker: ACKERMAN
dialogues.text: (re: Milner and June) Take ‘em out!  105.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Milner...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I got it. He calmly pulls out a detonation device in his hand. The opposite end of the balcony EXPLODES, and the Worse G go flying. We hear other CHARGES he’s set around the compound GOING when --

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDOS
dialogues.text: Rappel down onto the balcony on.ropes from above and swar from every door, armed to the teeth. They all wear matchi uniforms, emblazoned with a LOGO that resembles the famou shot of the earth rising over the moon. They drag Ackerman and the surviving Worse Guys out of th rubble, swiftly and efficiently disarming them and taking them down. June looks on, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: (realizing) The IIA?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (shrugging) We're the Watchdogs of the World. June smiles, relieved. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You know, I’m glad you decided to trust me before they showed up, because that would have made your choice ridiculously easy. The commando LEADER drops beside Milner and removes his goggles. We recognize him as the Maitre D’ from the restaurant where they first met.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Johnny Milner does it again.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: You were supposed to be here at 0800! I had to do it all by myself.  106.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: No, it was 0900...

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Don‘t you remember the plan?

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: There was a plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June follows Milner into the wrecked room, amazed, as the commandos round up and drag away the last of the bad guys around them -- the New Freedom Coalition, their Guards, a the Worse Guys. Sporadic MACHINE GUN FIRE continues elsewhere in the comp as Milner grabs a bottle of wine and a couple of glasses have miraculously made it through the mayhem. He checks the wine label. Impressed, he pours them both a drink.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: (hands her glass) Admit it. This was the best first date you've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: It's up there. They toast and drink.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: So -- wanna do it again?

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Maybe. Call me. I don’t want to come off desperate. Milner grins.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Oh! I almost forgot... June takes out the battery and hands it to Milner.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Here. Keep it safe.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, about that... this one’s not real, either.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Then where is the real one?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Nowhere. It hasn’t actually been invented yet.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I mean, they’re working on it, but it’s still a ways off. But now when it is invented, we will have already taken out all the guys who were going to go after it. See how it works? °

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: My brain hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in the Mate-dot-com ad. Only now, Milner dives into pool, swims under the water, surfaces to where June waits kisses her...

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: You know, it may be time for you to meet my mom.

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I'd love to. Is she like you? June thinks, then...

dialogues.speaker: . JUNE
dialogues.text: Yeah. She is. the and Just then, across the grounds, June hears the ROAR of sev jeeps pull up beside a thatched-roof boathouse.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... A couple DRUG LORD-types and their entourage of armed BODYGUARDS emerge from the jeeps and enter the boathouse.  108.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: Time for work. Milner climbs out of the pool, as June reaches into a bea bag and pulls out two enormous MACHINE GUNS. She hands one to Milner, along with some CLIPS. They lock and load as they approach the boathouse. .

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: What are you making for dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: Steak au poivre.

dialogues.speaker: JUNE
dialogues.text: I love steak au poivre!

dialogues.speaker: MILNER
dialogues.text: I know. They share a quick kiss. Milner kicks in the door of the boathouse, as the two burst in, GUNS BLAZING, and we... FADE OUT.
